head.citation-title: 15th IAPR International Workshop on Document Analysis Systems, DAS 2022
head.abstracts: The proceedings contain 52 papers. The special focus in this conference is on Document Analysis Systems. The topics include: Text Detection and Post-OCR Correction in Engineering Documents; using Multi-level Segmentation Features for Document Image Classification; SciBERTSUM: Extractive Summarization for Scientific Documents; is Multitask Learning Always Better?; QAlayout: Question Answering Layout Based on Multimodal Attention for Visual Question Answering on Corporate Document; investigating the Effect of Using Synthetic and Semi-synthetic Images for Historical Document Font Classification; combining Visual and Linguistic Models for a Robust Recipient Line Recognition in Historical Documents; the Winner Takes It All: Choosing the “best” Binarization Algorithm for Photographed Documents; a Generic Image Retrieval Method for Date Estimation of Historical Document Collections; evaluation of Named Entity Recognition in Handwritten Documents; Combining Image Processing Techniques, OCR, and OMR for the Digitization of Musical Books; challenging Children Handwriting Recognition Study Exploiting Synthetic, Mixed and Real Data; HST-GAN: Historical Style Transfer GAN for Generating Historical Text Images; AttentionHTR: Handwritten Text Recognition Based on Attention Encoder-Decoder Networks; ReadOCR: A Novel Dataset and Readability Assessment of OCRed Texts; NCERT5K-IITRPR: A Benchmark Dataset for Non-textual Component Detection in School Books; a Benchmark of Named Entity Recognition Approaches in Historical Documents Application to 19 th Century French Directories; a Comprehensive Study of Open-Source Libraries for Named Entity Recognition on Handwritten Historical Documents; open Source Handwritten Text Recognition on Medieval Manuscripts Using Mixed Models and Document-Specific Finetuning; a Comprehensive Comparison of Open-Source Libraries for Handwritten Text Recognition in Norwegian; keyword Spotting with Quaternionic ResNet: Application to Spotting in Greek Manuscripts; approximate Search for Keywords in Handwritten Text Images; writer Identification and Writer Retrieval Using Vision Transformer for Forensic Documents; on-the-Fly Deformations for Keyword Spotting; revealing Reliable Signatures by Learning Top-Rank Pairs; a Light Transformer-Based Architecture for Handwritten Text Recognition.
